paper_abstract: Denote by C the class of oracles relative to which P = NP (collapsing oracles), and by S the class of oracles relative to which P not equal 0 NP (separating oracles). We present structural results on C and S. Using a diagonalization argument, we show that neither C nor S is closed under disjoint union, also known as join. We show that this implies that neither C nor S is closed under union, intersection, or symmetric difference. Consequently EL(1), the first level of the extended low hierarchy, is not closed under join. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
